paper_title: On existence of two positive solutions for the nonlinear subelliptic equations involving nonuniformly p-Laplacian
abstract:
In this paper, we study a solvability result for the nonlinear problem $$ \mbox {div } \left ( \vert 
abla_ωu\vert^{p-2}
abla_ωu ight )+v(x) u^{q-1}+μu^{γ-1}=0, \quad z\in Ω, \quad u \Big \vert_{\partial Ω}=0. $$ assuming for the weight functions $ v \in A_\infty, \, ω\in A_p $ to belong the Muckenhoupt class and a balance condition of Chanillo-Wheeden's type, with degenerate gradient $
abla_ωu =\left ( ω^{1/p} 
abla_x, \, 
abla_y ight ) $ and its module $ \vert 
abla_ωu\vert= \left (ω(x)^{2/p} \vert 
abla_{x}u \vert ^2+\vert 
abla_{y}u\vert^2 ight )^{ rac{1}{2}}; $ the domain $ Ω\subset \mathbb{R}^N $ is bounded, $ N=n+m, x\in \mathbb{R}^n, \, y\in \mathbb{R}^m$ and $z=(x, y) \in \mathbb{R}^N.$ The range conditions $ q \in (p, pN/(N-p)) $ and $ γ\in \left (1, N/(N-1)ight ) $ (or $γ\in (1, p)$ and $v^{-γ/(q-γ)}\in L_{1,loc}(Ω)$ additionally) and $ μ\in (0, Λ) $ with sufficiently small $ Λ$ are assumed also.
